Pitch Your Session

Our peer-led sessions combine skillsharing, discussion, and collaboration. Proposals are open through April 10!

photo by Erik Westra

Propose a Session

Proposals will be published on this site (fields marked as private excepted), and the sessions we accept will form the program for the two-day conference. Check out our advice for pitching and running a great session for examples and more detailed guidance on proposing a session, and feel free to contact us if you have any questions about your proposal.

So tell us, what’s your perfect SRCCON session?

About SRCCON

SRCCON is a conference for developers, designers, and data analysts in newsrooms—and many others in allied roles and fields. Join us in Portland, OR, July 28 and 29 for two days of peer-to-peer sessions built around conversation and collaboration. Keep up with updates @SRCCON.

About OpenNews

Knight-Mozilla OpenNews is a joint project of Mozilla and the Knight Foundation that supports the growing community of news developers, designers, and data reporters helping journalism thrive on the open web. More at opennews.org and @OpenNews.
